page.title: 01Introduction
page.content:
Nearly all of the land in our survey area is used for{farming.}
The area is a patchwork of fairly small fields separated by hedgerows. Some of the fields are quite steep. Nearly all of them provide grazing for cattle and sheep. Many of them are cut for hay or silage.
Hardly any of the land is flat. There is quite a lot of woodland in the area, some of it deciduous and some coniferous. None of these woods is very large but they do make the scenery more interesting.
The area is sparcely populated, mostly scattered farms and cottages except for the village of Harbertonford.
